question: Searching is the process of finding a specific ________ in a collection of data.
A contact list on your phone is an example of a ________ where searching is performed.
The two common methods of searching in an array are ________ and ________ search.
________ search checks each element of the array one by one until it finds the target value.
In Linear Search, the worst-case time complexity is ________.
The best case for Linear Search occurs when the target is found at the ________ position.
Binary Search works only on a ________ array.
Binary Search follows the ________ and ________ strategy.
The time complexity of Binary Search in the worst case is ________.
Binary Search is faster than Linear Search for ________ datasets.
If the middle element is smaller than the target in Binary Search, we search the ________ half.
In Linear Search, if the target is not found, the function returns ________.
Binary Search requires the array to be in ________ order.
In the best case of Binary Search, the target is found in the ________ iteration.
If the target is greater than the middle element in Binary Search, we eliminate the ________ half.
In Linear Search, the number of comparisons in the worst case is equal to ________.
Binary Search is efficient for ________ datasets.
The primary advantage of Binary Search over Linear Search is its ________ speed.
Linear Search is most effective when the dataset is ________.
Binary Search follows the approach of repeatedly dividing the search space into ________.
